com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.std.functions

Class ConvertedArgument<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacmlatt.pdp.std.functions.ConvertedArgument<I>

  • public class ConvertedArgument<I>
extends java.lang.Object
    A ConvertedArgument is the result of processing an FunctionArgument to validate its correctness and to convert it into an object of the required type. It is returned by the validateArguments method in FunctionDefinitionHomogeneousSimple and should only be used by other Functions in that same package. This is a data holder with no processing. It contains two elements:
    • A Status object, and
    • An object containing the value of the FunctionArgument processed by validateArguments. This object will only exist if status.isOk() (or the isOk() method in this class that calls status.isOk()) is true.
    Author:
    glenngriffin

      • ConvertedArgument

        public ConvertedArgument(FunctionArgument functionArgument,
                 DataType<I> expectedDataType,
                 boolean expectBag)
        Evaluates the given FunctionArgument and validates that it has the correct DataType. The returned object will be either:
        • A Status Object indicating an error condition, or
        • An Object of the appropriate type containing the value of the function. In this case the caller should assume that the Status is Status.OK. Note that the object may be a bag if that is what the caller expected.
        Parameters:
        listFunctionArguments - the List of FunctionArguments to validate
        convertedValues - the List of U that the converted value is added to.

      • getShortDataTypeId

        public java.lang.String getShortDataTypeId(Identifier identifier)
        Returns a shortened version of the given DataType Id, primarily for use with error messages to prevent them from becoming too long. This is a simple convenience method to reduce code bloat.
        Parameters:
        identifier - expected to have '#' in it, and if no '#' should have ":data-type:"
        Returns:
